text: At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint or even remember it. It is enough.
author: Toni Morrison

text: Light, God's eldest daughter, is a principal beauty in a building.
author: Thomas Fuller

text: Beauty is about perception, not about make-up. I think the beginning of all beauty is knowing and liking oneself. You can't put on make-up, or dress yourself, or do you hair with any sort of fun or joy if you're doing it from a position of correction.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: That's why I began doing makeup in the first place: I was hoping that through helping people see the beauty in themselves, I could try and find it in me.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: Beauty is only skin deep. I think what's really important is finding a balance of mind, body and spirit.
author: Jennifer Lopez
